qas.question: How large is the membership of Freemasonry?
What is the largest single jurisdiction of Freemasonry?
How many members does the UGLE have?
What are the membership numbers of the United States?
How many members does the Grand Lodge of Scotland and the Grand Lodge of Ireland have, together?
How many members are in Freemasonry?
What lodge has the single largest single jurisdiction of Freemasonry?

answers.text: the United Grand Lodge of England

qas.question: How many members are in the Grand Lodge of England?
The Grand Lodges of Scotland and Ireland have how many member?
The United States has how many Freemason members?
How many people lost membership of Freemasonry?
What is the only single jurisdiction of Freemasonry?
How many members does the UGLE lose every year?
How many members left the United States?

context: Freemasonry, as it exists in various forms all over the world, has a membership estimated by the <b11_0>United Grand Lodge of England<b11_0/> at <a0_0><a5_0><b10_0>around six million worldwide<b10_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>. The fraternity is administratively organised into independent Grand Lodges (or sometimes Grand Orients), each of which governs its own Masonic jurisdiction, which consists of subordinate (or constituent) Lodges. The largest single jurisdiction, in terms of membership, is <a6_0>the <a1_0>United Grand Lodge of England<a6_0/><a1_0/> (with a membership estimated at <a2_0><a7_0><b12_0>around a quarter million<b12_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/>). The Grand Lodge of Scotland and Grand Lodge of Ireland (taken together) have <a8_0>approximately <a4_0><b14_0>150,000<b14_0/><a4_0/> members<a8_0/>. In the United States total membership is <a3_0><a9_0><b13_0>just under two million<b13_0/><a9_0/><a3_0/>.
